intro: Hedyotis schlechtendahliana subsp. waimeae, commonly known as the Waimea bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. It has slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
